title: Collect Rainwater and Dew at Sea
brief: Maximize freshwater collection from rain and dew using tarps and available materials.
steps: Step 1: Watch clouds continuously and keep tarpaulin ready for catching water.
Step 2: If tarp is encrusted with dried salt, wash it in seawater before rain collection.
Step 3: When it rains, drink as much as you can hold immediately.
Step 4: At night, secure tarpaulin like sunshade with edges turned up to collect dew.
Step 5: Collect dew along raft sides using sponge or cloth.
Step 6: Accept that small amounts of seawater mixed with rain are hardly noticeable and won't cause harm.
warnings: In rough seas you cannot get uncontaminated fresh water.
Normal small amount of seawater mixed with rain will not cause physical reaction.
Be careful not to get bottom of raft wet during collection process.
